subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Angela Stanford spoiled Michelle Wie’s bid for a victory in her first start as an L.P.G.A. Tour member, overcoming a three-stroke deficit to win the season-opening SBS Open by three shots at Turtle Bay in Kahunu, Hawaii. Stanford closed with a two-under-par 70 for a 10-under 206 total. It was her fourth career victory and third in seven starts. Wie, 19, had a 73 for her second straight runner-up finish in the tournament. Angela Park had a 75, tying for third with Na Yeon Choi (69) at 212. ¶Gil Morgan shot a seven-under 65 and finished tied with Tom Jenkins after two rounds of the Allianz Championship in Boca Raton, Fla. Jenkins shot a 67 for the second straight day, matching Morgan at 10 under through 36 holes. Mike Goodes (68) and Jerry Pate (71) are one shot off the lead. Bernhard Langer, fell apart over the last four holes — with two bogeys and a double-bogey — to finish with a 73. He finished the round three shots behind. allianz (AP).
